snippet: The second-place winner in New Hampshire is not really a member of the Republican party, and neither are many of his supporters.
abstract: The second-place winner in New Hampshire is not really a member of the Republican party, and neither are many of his supporters.
lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, N.H. - The numbers say Ron Paul came in second in the New Hampshire Republican primary on Tuesday, but the Republican party is just a convenience for Mr. Paul, through which he spreads his other-worldly message. He is not really a member of the party in its current form, and more importantly, neither are many of his supporters.
